intro: Oncostylus pusillus, commonly known as the small horned weevil, is a small beetle belonging to the family Curculionidae. It is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive, horn-like structures on its head. The plant it is associated with is the genus Oncostylus, which is part of the legume family, Fabaceae. Oncostylus pusillus primarily feeds on the foliage and flowers of its host plants, contributing to their ecological dynamics. Its life cycle involves laying eggs on plant tissues, where the larvae develop before pupating and emerging as adults.
